Error Handling#

Hyperion provides robust methods for communicating, propagating, and handling errors, from low-level basic functionality like simple status code types to high-level ergonomics, including monadic sum-types similar to Rust’s Option and Result and C++17’s std::optional and C++23’s std::expected. Create custom error code categories in hyperion::error::StatusCodeDomain s, create codes from those categories via hyperion::error::StatusCode<hyperion::error::StatusCodeDomain> s, package them in hyperion::error::Error, and communicate and propagate them via hyperion::Result<T, E>. Communicate optional values or obvious failure cases (for example, in a checked math function) with hyperion::Option<T>. Assert valid pre and post conditions at runtime with HYPERION_ASSERT and fail fast and gracefully when irrecoverable errors occur with panic.

Example#
 1#include <Hyperion/Error.h>
 2#include <Hyperion/Result.h>
 3#include <Hyperion/Option.h>
 4
 5using hyperion::i32;
 6using hyperion::operator""_i32;
 7using hyperion::Err;
 8using hyperion::Ok;
 9using hyperion::None;
10using hyperion::Some;
11
12// import calculation returns an i32 on success, but can fail with a POSIX error code
13auto important_calculation(i32 input) -> hyperion::Result<i32, hyperion::error::PosixError>;
14// checked_add does a basic range-checked add, returning None if the result would be out of
15
16// range
17auto checked_add(i32 lhs, i32 rhs) -> hyperion::Option<i32> {
18    if(std::numeric_limits<i32>::max() - lhs < rhs || std::numeric_limits<i32>::min() + lhs > rhs) {
19        return None();
20    }
21
22    return Some(lhs + rhs);
23}
24
25auto important_calculation2(i32 input) -> hyperion::Result<i32, hyperion::error::PosixError> {
26    // input can't be the meaning of life
27    HYPERION_ASSERT(input != 42_i32,
28                    "Invalid input for input in important_calculation2: {}",
29                    input);
30    /// Get the results of our calculations, check if they were successful, then return the
31    /// result or error
32    auto res = important_calculation(input);
33    auto sum = checked_add(input, 42_i32);
34
35    // if the checked add was out of range, return an EDOM error to communicate that
36    if(sum.is_none()) {
37        return Err(hyperion::error::PosixError(EDOM));
38    }
39
40    if(res.is_err()) {
41        return res;
42    }
43
44    return Ok(sum.unwrap() * res.unwrap());
45
46    // Alternatively, `Option` and `Result` both have shorthands for these operations, `ok_or`
47    // and `and_then`, respectively, and we could have used them like this:
48
49    // if checked_add returned `Some(value)`, return `Ok(value)`, otherwise return
50    // `Err(hyperion::error::PosixError(EDOM)`
51    checked_add(input, 42_i32)
52        .ok_or(hyperion::error::PosixError(EDOM))
53        // If the result of the previous calls was `Ok(lhs)`, call the lambda and return that
54        // value as a `Result`. Otherwise, propagate the previous error
55        .and_then([input](auto lhs) {
56            // If `important_calculation2` was `Ok(rhs)`, call the lambda and return that value
57            // as a `Result`. Otherwise, propagate the previous error
58            important_calculation2(input).and_then([lhs](auto rhs) {
59                return lhs * rhs;
60            });
61        });
62}
63
64auto get_important_value() -> i32 {
65    // get the result of `important_calculation2`, fail if it's an error, return the result
66    // if it was successful
67    auto result = important_calculation2(63_i32);
68
69    // if the result of important_calculation2 is an error, we don't have a way to handle it
70    // so we trigger a panic
71    if(result.is_err()) {
72        panic("get_important_value failed! We can't continue!");
73    }
74
75    return result.unwrap();
76
77    // Alternatively, `Result` has a shorthand for this pattern, `expect` and we could have
78    // called it instead of manually checking for the error like this:
79    return important_calculation2(63_i32)
80                .expect("get_important_value failed! We can't continue");
81}
